creator: kimboon@mail.com
text:
I have been using Ant 1.3 for my development work under JDK 1.3, I like the 
feature very much, though the user friendliness need to be further improved.

Recently I downloaded and installed JDK1.3.1, and realize ANT no long work... 
Everytime I run the ant.bat, it always shows error : "Modern compiler is not 
available...." I tried almost everything, but still couldn't get it work... 
In the end, I reinstall back to JDK1.3, and it works again !! 

Where has gone wrong ? Ant ? or JDK ?

This message typically happens when tools.jar is not in the classpath.
tools.jar is set in the launch script, it is located at %JAVA_HOME%
\lib\tools.jar and will not be in the system classpath if...it does not exist.

Could you please check that your environment is OK ?

I'm setting the resolution as 'fixed' since we are about 30 developers to use 
JDK 1.3.1 in my company and I'm using it also at home...
creator: sbailliez@imediation.com
christoph.wilhelms@t-online.de
text:
Ant 1.3 (release) won't work if the JDK is placed in a folder with "spaces" in 
it like in "Program Files" and the JAVA_HOME is set to this folder. Solve it by 
setting JAVA_HOME like this: set JAVA_HOME=C:\PROGRA~1\JDK1.3.1; Additionally 
Ant schould not be placed in a path containing spaces (the same for ANT_HOME, 
as for JAVA_HOME)

creator: kimboon@mail.com
text:
I know about the tools.jar and the space problem and my environment was set 
correctly, that's why it made me so irritated when it just couldn't work once i 
installed JDK1.3.1 (and work when I reverted back to JDK 1.3).

my JAVA_HOME is D:\jdk1.3.1, tools.jar is included in the classpath as it's set 
in my ant.bat.
